title: As a beginner, how can I check my answer writing practice for the UPSC main? - Quora
tags: Union Public Service Commission of India

response.answer_text: As you are beginner so you have to be cautious about your time and money. A wrong approach and wrong mentor can be disastrous for your carrier. Let's see how to start and ace it. I hope you are completed your basic books like NCERTs, spectrum, Laxmikant, lexicon etc. If not then complete them first. First of all see previous year question papers and analysis theme to choose right questions from questions available in market online or offline.You can see toppers answer sheet for basic idea of answer structuring.It is better to start with NCERTs with small questions at the end of chapter or previous year question papers.Choosing questions from NCERT and PYQP you can review your self by referring answers or books.Join any daily answer writing platforms to improve, which can provide you a detailed review of your answers. You can join IASNETWORK at minimal cost.And after Prelims you can join full length test series.

There are five ways to check your answers, it depends on which method you find effective and comfortable - Getting answers evaluated from your teachers.Posting answers on blogs like insights and getting feedback from aspirants.Self checking - It involves analysing your answers yourself. You can do so by reading the source of question like from internet or newspaper.Forming a group of sincere aspirants and checking each other's answers while giving honest feedback.Comparing your answers from standard answer key published, but for this type questions have to be taken from these booklets.Hope this solves your question !

I suggest you to go for an online portal or coaching centre where you can get answers reviewed from qualified tutors. Do not write randomly for the sake of writing. Suppose you hear only the 1000 answers part & you writes 1500 answer. THIS MAY NOT WORK. When you write an answer, make sure that you gets it reviewed. The most important thing is to avoid repeating same mistakes again & again. The Answer should be not redundant.  I enrolled my name in a program called EDENIAS: STEPS (Daily Mains Answer Writing Program) and I am totally satisfied with this program, the program covers entire syllabus in 3 months by daily answer writing and best of best evaluated copies are provided within 72 hours, if someone is looking for any Answer Writing Program, I would suggest for this program. Thanks!!

You say you are a beginner than best way is you join a peer group and have your answers evaluated by them. Another method is ask your seniors if they have some time to cater to review your answers and get the feedback. Another method, write your answers on digital platforms like INSIGHTSIAS, IASBABA and let them have corrected. Or better is join some telegram/whatsapp group and post your answers and ask members to scrutinize it. Finally, shell some money and join some test series. They will evaluate your answer and send you synopsis and remarks. Any of the above method works. Use the trial and error method and chose wisely. Cheers!! Peace out!!

Insights You can visit Global leader in learning and development solutions - Insights They daily upload questions there and various aspirants post their answers. From there you will learn many useful things about answer writing and will come to know where do you need an improvement. Unacademy Visit Unacademy - India's largest learning platform There are some answer writing courses in which the questions will be uploaded in the morning session and their answers will be discussed in the evening/night. Thank you!
